summary.para: Retrieves the type information from the specified index.

param.name: iti
param.para: The index of the type information for which you want to obtain information. Index 0 is the default interface of the extender object; index *pcti-1 is the index of the base object.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A bitfield indicating which out parameters are being requested. Indicating a particular flag results in the appropriate information being assigned to the associated out parameter. This parameter can be one of the following values.

description.para: Indicates a request for pptiCoClass information.
Indicates a request for pcdispidReserved and pdwTIFlags information.
Indicates a request for piidPrimary information.
Indicates a request for piidSource information.

param.name: pptiCoClass
param.para: The coclass type information for the requested contributor. See ITypeInfo.

param.name: pcdispidReserved
param.para: The number of DISPIDs the default interface of pptiCoClass reserves for its own use. This number can be used to calculate the amount to offset DISPIDs in the reserved range implemented by the object this class is extending.

param.name: piidPrimary
param.para: The IID of the primary interface for the requested contributor.

param.name: piidSource
param.para: The IID of the default source interface for the requested contributor.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_POINTER, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of type information blocks that this object must provide.

param.name: pcti
param.para: The number of type information blocks that this object must provide.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_POINTER, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

summary.para: An extension to that makes it faster and easier to retrieve type information from a component that may have multiple coclasses that determine its behavior.
